name: Togo
introduction: French Togoland became Togo in 1960. Gen. Gnassingbe EYADEMA installed as military ruler in 1967 ruled Togo with a heavy hand for almost four decades. Despite the facade of multi-party elections instituted in the early 1990s the government was largely dominated by President EYADEMA whose Rally of the Togolese People (RPT) party has been in power almost continually since 1967 and its successor the Union for the Republic maintains a majority of seats in today's legislature. Upon EYADEMA's death in February 2005 the military installed the president's son Faure GNASSINGBE and then engineered his formal election two months later. Democratic gains since then allowed Togo to hold its first relatively free and fair legislative elections in October 2007. After years of political unrest and condemnation from international organizations for human rights abuses Togo is finally being re-welcomed into the international community.
overview: The French Southern and Antarctic Lands is an overseas territory of France.

languages.name: Adele
languages.area: West central, Koué Mpotì, Yégué are main centers. Difficult access to area. Upper Adele in Togo, Lower Adele in Ghana. Also in Ghana.

languages.name: Adangbe
languages.area: Togo border area east of Ho. Agotime mostly in Volta region, Kpoeta, Apegame. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Igo
languages.area: Plateau region, Apeyeme Prefecture, Bogo-Ahlon Canton, Sassanou village area.

languages.name: Aja (Benin)
languages.area: Southwest on Mono River. Primarily in Couffo Province (formerly north Mono Province), Aplahoué, Djakotomè, Dogbo, Klouékanmè, Lalo, and Tovinklin Subprefectures; Mono Province (formerly south Mono Province) Athiémè, Comè, and Houéyogbé Subprefectures; Zou Province, Djidja and Agbangnizoun Subprefectures, Cotonou and many towns in the south, villages mixed with other language groups. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Akan
languages.area: Asante are south central, Ashanti Province; Akuapem are southeast, north of Accra; Fante are south central, between Winneba, Takoradi, and Obuasi.

languages.name: Akaselem
languages.area: Central region east of Sokodé, Tchamba Prefecture.

languages.name: North Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).

languages.name: Aguna
languages.area: Zou Province, Djidja Subprefecture, Agouna village area.

languages.name: Ginyanga
languages.area: Central region, Blitta Prefecture, west and south of Blitta.

languages.name: Baatonum
languages.area: Central, north, Borgou Province. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Biali
languages.area: Atakora Province, Materi Subprefecture; Borgou Province, Ouessi Subprefecture. Also in Burkina Faso.

languages.name: Bissa
languages.area: South central, Boulgou and Zoundweogo provinces, Garango, Zabré, Gomboussougou, Tenkodogo cities. Also in Côte d’Ivoire, Ghana, Togo.

languages.name: Anii
languages.area: Both sides of Togo-Benin border; south Aracora Province, Bassila Subprefecture. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Bago-Kusuntu
languages.area: Central region, Tchamba Prefecture, Koussountou (25 km southeast of Tchamba) and Bagou (35 km south of Koussountou) are main centers.

languages.name: Bassari
languages.area: Southeast, Upper Casamance, Edun area; border areas, Kedougou, Tambacounda. Also in Gambia, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau.

languages.name: Ntcham
languages.area: West central, Bassar, Kabou, Kalanga areas. Also in Ghana.

languages.name: Anufo
languages.area: Northeast, Wawjayga area. Also in Benin, Togo.

languages.name: Dagbani
languages.area: Northeast Tamale area, as far as Yendi.

languages.name: German
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Ecuador, Estonia, Finland, France, Hungary, Israel, Italy, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Moldova, Mozambique, Namibia, Paraguay, Philippines, Poland, Puerto Rico, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United States, Uruguay, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Lukpa
languages.area: West Djougou and border areas, Atakora Province. Primarily Kémérida area. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Ewe
languages.area: Southeast corner. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Fon
languages.area: Zou Province, Atlantic Province, south Abomey-Calavi and Ouidah Subprefectures; Littoral Province, Cotonou. Interspersed with other groups south and in towns north. Also in Togo.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: French Sign Language
languages.area: Southern FSL is used in Marseille, Toulon, La Ciotat, and Salon de Provence. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Borgu Fulfulde
languages.area: Atakora and Borgou provinces, villages, and encampments; Borgou region, Bakuure north of N’Dali; central and south Borgou region, Parakou area, Korakuure; north, Atacora region, Djougoure, from Djougou north to Burkina border. May extend west into north Togo; Tchabankeere in Zou region. Also in Nigeria, Togo.

languages.name: Ga
languages.area: Southeast, Accra coast area.

languages.name: Gen
languages.area: Southeast, Maritime region. Also in Benin.

languages.name: Ngangam
languages.area: Savana region, Oti Prefecture, Gando-Namoni, Mogou, Koumongou, and Kountouri areas. Also in Benin.

languages.name: Gourmanchéma
languages.area: East, Gourma, Tapoa, Gnagna, Komandjari, Yagha, and Kompienga provinces, below scrub land that blends into the Sahara. Also in Benin, Niger, Togo.

languages.name: Hausa
languages.area: Sokoto, Kaduna, Katsina, Kano, Bauchi, Jigawa, Zamfara, Kebbi, and Gombe states. Spoken as L2 in north. Also in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Congo, Eritrea, Germany, Ghana, Niger, Sudan, Togo.

languages.name: Ifè
languages.area: South, Northeast Plateau region, Ogou and Est-Mono prefectures. Atakpamé, Kamina, Dadja, and Ese-Ana are main centers. Also in Benin.

languages.name: Kabiyè
languages.area: Kara region, mostly Kozah and Binah prefectures. 2/3 in Central and Plateau regions, Sotouboua, Blitta, Kloto, Ogou, Amlame, Wawa, and Haho prefectures. Also in Benin, Ghana.

languages.name: Tem
languages.area: Kara region, Bafilo Subprefecture; Central region, Tchoudjo and Sotouboua prefectures; Bafilo, Sokode, and Sotouboua are main centers; Plateau region near Badou. Also in Benin, Ghana.

languages.name: Kpessi
languages.area: Central Togo, East Mono Prefecture, Kpessi and Nyamassila cantons; Blitta Prefecture, Langabou Canton.

languages.name: Akebu
languages.area: South, Prefecture de Wawa, Canton Akebou, into Ghana. Main centers Kougnohou, Veh-Nkougna, Kamina.

languages.name: Ikposo
languages.area: Plateau region, Amou, Wawa and Ogou prefectures, west of Atakpamé. Main centers are Amlamé, Amou-Oblo, Atakpamé. Also in Ghana.

languages.name: Kusaal
languages.area: Northeast corner, Bawku District. Also in Burkina Faso.

languages.name: Krache
languages.area: Central, near Nchimburu, Kete Krachi area.

languages.name: Lamba
languages.area: Copperbelt, Central, and southeast Northwestern provinces. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Lama (Togo)
languages.area: Kara region, Kande and Doufelgou prefectures; 50% of the population in Central and Plateau regions, Sotouboua, Ogou, and Haho prefectures; important minority in Lomé. Also in Benin, Ghana.

languages.name: Lelemi
languages.area: Southeast, Jasikan town.

languages.name: Mampruli
languages.area: Northeast Northern region, east and west of Gambaga. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Moba
languages.area: Northwest Savana region. Main towns Dapaong and Bombouaka. Also in Burkina Faso.

languages.name: Mossi
languages.area: Central Ouagadougou area; widespread. Also in Benin, Côte d’Ivoire, Ghana, Mali, Senegal, Togo.

languages.name: Mbelime
languages.area: Atakora Province, Cobly Subprefecture, and 5 villages in Boukombe Subprefecture.

languages.name: Maxi Gbe
languages.area: Collines Province (formerly north Zou Province), Dassa-Zoume, Savalou, Bante, Glazoue, and Ouessi subprefectures. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Nawdm
languages.area: Kara region, Niamtougou area, Doufelgou Prefecture; Central and Plateau regions, Sotouboua, Ogou, and Haho prefectures; important minority in Lomé. Also in Ghana.

languages.name: Delo
languages.area: East central border with Togo. The paramount chief is at Brewaniase, 35 km south of Nkwanta. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Miyobe
languages.area: Atakora Province. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Ditammari
languages.area: Atakora Province, Boukombe and Natitingou subprefectures; along Djougou-Parakou road. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Waci Gbe
languages.area: Main centers Vogan, Tabligbo, Attitigon. Also in Benin.

languages.name: Cameroon Pidgin
languages.area: Primarily South West and North West provinces; widespread elsewhere.

languages.name: Wudu
languages.area: Gbékon and Glitho are main centers.

languages.name: Waama
languages.area: Atakora Province, at least 20 villages. Natitingou is cultural center. Several thousand in Cotonou, Parakou area, and west Nigeria.

languages.name: Northern Nago
languages.area: Donga Province (formerly south Atakora Province), Bassila Subprefecture south and west of Bassila town, Bante Subprefecture south of Bassila along route RNIE3. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Konkomba
languages.area: Northeast border area, Guerin, Yendi District; north central, many scattered groups. Also in Togo.

languages.name: Yoruba
languages.area: Most of Oyo, Ogun, Ondo, Osun, Kwara, and Lagos states; Kogi state, west LGAs. Also in Benin, Sierra Leone, Togo, United Kingdom, United States.
